alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:18PM MDT until July 06 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL JOHNSON COUNTY... At 418 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Fort Reno Historical Site, which is also 23 miles northeast of Kaycee, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Fort Reno Historical Site. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
